intro: Valeriana thalictroides, commonly known as the golden valerian, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and typically grows in moist, woodland habitats. The plant features showy, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Valeriana thalictroides is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance as a food source for pollinators.
